title: Duke's Sports Blog
text:
Sys.setenv(CFBD_API_KEY = "zd/Ub4BnBvnRyJhUIBkTNDDC4jPNT5T59jKNegdxz0LRNPDCsFE/7Wv9x7cKhLHU")


library(httr)
library(jsonlite)

url <- "https://api.collegefootballdata.com/games/weather?year=2024&classification=fbs"

res <- GET(
  url,
  add_headers(
    Authorization = paste("Bearer", Sys.getenv("CFBD_API_KEY")),
    `User-Agent` = "R Client",
    accept = "application/json"
  )
)

# Convert response
json_text <- content(res, "text", encoding = "UTF-8")
data <- fromJSON(json_text)

# Save to CSV
write.csv(data, "weather_2024.csv", row.names = FALSE)

print(head(data))

library(tidyverse)

Sys.setenv(CFBD_API_KEY = "zd/Ub4BnBvnRyJhUIBkTNDDC4jPNT5T59jKNegdxz0LRNPDCsFE/7Wv9x7cKhLHU")


library(httr)
library(jsonlite)
library(dplyr)

url <- "https://api.collegefootballdata.com/games?year=2024&classification=fbs"

res <- GET(
  url,
  add_headers(
    Authorization = paste("Bearer", Sys.getenv("CFBD_API_KEY")),
    `User-Agent` = "R Client",
    accept = "application/json"
  )
)

# Check response
if (status_code(res) != 200) stop("API request failed!")

# Convert JSON and flatten
json_text <- content(res, "text", encoding = "UTF-8")
data <- fromJSON(json_text, flatten = TRUE)

# Remove any remaining list-columns
list_cols <- sapply(data, is.list)
data[list_cols] <- NULL  # drop problematic columns

# Save to CSV
write.csv(data, "games_2024.csv", row.names = FALSE)

# Preview
print(head(data))

         id season week seasonType                startDate startTimeTBD

library(httr)
library(jsonlite)
library(dplyr)

url <- "https://api.collegefootballdata.com/scoreboard?classification=fbs"

res <- GET(
  url,
  add_headers(
    Authorization = paste("Bearer", Sys.getenv("CFBD_API_KEY")),
    `User-Agent` = "R Client",
    accept = "application/json"
  )
)

# Check response
if (status_code(res) != 200) stop("API request failed!")

# Convert JSON and flatten
json_text <- content(res, "text", encoding = "UTF-8")
data <- fromJSON(json_text, flatten = TRUE)

# Remove any remaining list-columns
list_cols <- sapply(data, is.list)
data[list_cols] <- NULL  # drop problematic columns

# Save to CSV
write.csv(data, "scores_2024.csv", row.names = FALSE)

# Preview
print(head(data))

title: blog
text:
How Weather effects College Football

title: How Weather effects College Football
text:
Nebraska is the best.


Code
library(tidyverse)

title: About
text: My name is Duke Rood and I am a senior at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. I am passionate about sports and would love to work in the business side of sports. I am from Los Angeles, California, but would be open to live anywhere in this great country. Enjoy my blog!
